title: I accidentally got part of an aux cord stuck in the aux port of my car stereo. What can I do to get it out? - Quora

response.answer_text: The easiest way is to disassemble the unit and access the back of the jack, and you can push it out with a piece of stiff wire, like a paperclip. If that’s not an option you could try to put a drop of gel superglue on the end of that same piece of paperclip wire and put it in the socket, and hope you can glue the end of the wire to the broken piece of the plug. This probably won’t work because either your hand will shake and you’ll end up getting glue all over the socket and making the problem worse.The other issue is that there is often a plastic insulator gasket between the tip/ring/sleeve of the broken jack, and if that plastic is still in the socket, your superglue drop won’t stick to it, so all your efforts would be in vain. So that sends us back to the first option, which is to remove the entire head unit, open it up and push the broken part out from the back of the jack with a stiff piece of paperclip wire.

If it's an RCA connector, the ones on the left, they commonly have a plastic core, which makes them prone to snapping off. The following is how I got the snapped-off piece from such a cable: Wear gloves to protect your handHeat a needle or pin with a lighter until it's glowing redInsert the hot needle into the plastic core and allow it to coolPull the needle out. With any luck, the stuck piece will come with it.
